topic.title: Managing Server Groups
topic.shortdesc: You can place Couchbase Server nodes into logical groupings that correspond to their physical distribution, such as grouping by server rack, or by cloud availability zone.

p.note: The purpose of server groups is to enable Server Group Awareness. The Server Group Awareness feature is only available in Couchbase Server Enterprise Edition.

body.p: This section describes how to manage server groups using the Couchbase Server Web Console. You can also manage server groups using the Couchbase Server command-line interface (CLI) and REST API.

p.note: When you initialize a new Couchbase Server cluster, the first node is automatically placed in a server group named Group 1. Once you create additional server groups, the Assign Group field becomes available when adding new server nodes to the cluster.

section.title: Adding a Server Group
section.p: To add a new server group:

ol.li: Enter a name in the Group Name field, and then click Add Group.

body.section:
Moving Servers Between Server Groups
To move a server node from one server group to another:
Go to Servers > Groups.
Locate the server node that you want to move. Click the move to pull-down menu and select the server group that you want to move the server node to. The following message appears: pending move to <Group Name>.
Click Apply Changes to confirm the move. After you move a server node to a new server group, you need to rebalance the cluster. For optimal Server Group Awareness functionality, you should ensure that each server group has the same number of server nodes. See for more information.

section.title: Editing a Server Group Name
section.p: To edit the name of a server group:

ol.li: Locate the server node whose name you want to change, and then click edit name.
Enter a new name in the Group Name field, and then click Rename Group.

section.title: Deleting a Server Group
section.p: You can only delete a server group that is empty. Once you have removed all of the server nodes from a server group, the delete group option will appear.

ol.li: Locate the server group that you want to delete, and then click delete group.
In the Confirm Delete Group window, click Delete Group.
